subtitle: Make sure he plays in a safe area
description: Make sure he plays in a safe area
title: My baby is on the move!
content:
Created by BabyCenter
 


Now that your baby is on the move, it is time to make sure that he can play safely.

Make sure your baby cannot reach buckets of water or hot stoves or fires.

Wedge cupboard doors shut and move boxes and baskets high up where he cannot reach them.

Cleaning materials like bleach and washing powder can harm a baby, so lock these away.

Go down on your hands and knees so you can see the world from your baby’s angle. Dangling cords or plants may tempt him to reach up and pull things over on himself.

Put purses and shopping up high so he cannot reach them. Even simple everyday things like lipstick and make-up can harm him.

Make sure that medicines and tablets are out of his reach.

Keep him away from laundry areas, where washing powders and other dangerous chemicals cold fall within his reach, and dirty washing.

[Childproofing around the house][1]


  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/0_childproofing-around-the-house_460.bc
